location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 12 of 1866 from Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Charles Gonne, Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter regarding the fate of five small craft which were swamped during heavy weather; a bughlah [Buglah] which was sold and three Sooree [Sur] craft which had been sequestered by the Muskat [Muscat] authorities as part compensation for their own vessels plundered at sea by the Soor. The Government reply No. 822 of 1866 can be found on the verso of folio 68.Enclosed is a letter from Pelly to Mr G Rozario, in charge of local duties - Muskat, 15 February 1866 regarding the sale of the craft.
